title: Osher Günsberg was jobless before scoring The Bachelor hosting role
text:
He is one of the most successful reality TV hosts in Australian showbiz.

But Osher Günsberg, 45, has revealed he was jobless prior to landing the prime-time hosting gig on the Australian version of The Bachelor in 2013.

'I had no job and I was paying rent out of my savings in a foreign country,' he told TV Week on Tuesday.

Almost broke: Osher Günsberg, 45, has revealed to TV Week he was jobless prior to landing The Bachelor hosting role in 2013

'Then I had 10 weeks of work that year - which was The Bachelor season one - and I just prayed it would come along the following year.'

And luckily for him, it did.

The popular reality show recently wrapped its seventh season, with The Bachelorette, starring Angie Kent, starting this week.

'I just prayed it would come along the following year': Osher admitted he was praying The Bachelor would return after season one and fortunately for him, it did. Pictured L-R: The Bachelorette's Angie Kent, The Bachelor's Matt Agnew, Osher Günsberg

He also fronts Bachelor in Paradise Australia, but it's unclear whether that will return next year.

Osher also picked up the hosting role this year for Ten's smash hit, The Masked Singer Australia.

'The success of [The Masked Singer Australia] is another reason to be grateful but I won't stop being interested in the next job, and the next, because I know what it's like to not have a job at all.'

Another smash hit! Osher also picked up the hosting role this year for Ten's smash hit, The Masked Singer Australia

In August, the former Australian Idol host and his wife Audrey Griffin, 39, welcomed their first child, Wolfgang, together.

Revealing the photo was taken just over an hour after Audrey gave birth, Osher wrote: 'Getting skin to skin with our boy Wolfie.

'On the advice of superdad @kurtfearnleyinsta, I was whispering my first words to him, welcoming him to the world and making some promises to him. To say that the smell of him seeped into my brain and started to rewire things is an incredible understatement.

'We are now a few days in, and between feeds & nappy changes - whenever I can I'm whipping off my shirt and charging up on this little guy like he's an induction stove.'

His wife has a daughter, Georgia, 14, from a previous relationship.

New father: He recently welcomed his first child, Wolfgang, in August with wife Audrey
description: He is one of the most successful reality TV hosts in Australian showbiz.
authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
